The UI / UX Designer role holds responsibility for the construction of application designs for both internal and external user audiences.

The role is responsible for creating both functional and appealing features that address the client needs, and helping the company grow its customer base - as well as engaging with users to make their experience more user-friendly, intuitive and more efficient.

What that means day to day
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product analysts, product managers and developers.
• Understand product specifications and user psychology.
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps.
• Design graphical user interface elements; e.g. menus, tabs and widgets.
• Develop UI mock-ups, prototypes and wireframes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look, focusing on ease of use and minimize the need for training.
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. usability, findability and... responsiveness).
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with Product Managers and Developers.
• Modify and revise existing designs to meet changing customer preferences.
• Work closely with Product Managers and Developers to suggest improvements for products and processes.
• Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate over your designs.
• Take an active role in quality assurance of designs developed.
• Collaborate effectively with other team members and stakeholders.
• Present UI / UX design ideas to cross-functional teams and senior leadership.
• Stay up to date on current industry trends and market conditions.

What you’ll need to be successful

You'll have demonstrable work experience as a UI / UX Designer or similar role with HTML / CSS designer experience. You'll have experience with tools such as Adobe products;

PhotoShop / Illustrator, Balsamiq / InVision Mockups (or similar) and will have knowledge of JavaScript and Assistive technology.

You'll also have :
• Portfolio of design projects including digital experiences
• Experience working in an Agile environment
• Knowledge of accessibility usability standards and guidelines
• Good skills in user interface creation, user experience, website and app design
• Good communication skills both verbal and written to collaborate with various stakeholders
• Good time-management skills
• Problem-solving aptitude

FOR FUN You spend a significant percentage of your time with your colleagues (and what a great bunch of people they are!) and it’s important to us that everyone contributes to an environment that is positive and full of laughs.

We’ve always got something going on, from charity events and competitions to recognition events and awards and we encourage our teams to get involved and have fun along the way.

We offer a plethora of development resources and support, including access to LinkedIn learning to support you as you develop your career with us.

Last year alone we filled nearly 30% of our roles with internal candidates (which equates to almost 50 people being promoted!)

title: UX designer at a data start-up
description:
About Anmut

In 2018, Anmut was started to solve a big problem. We saw the world-changing potential of data being lost because most organisations don’t understand the real value of it. So we set up Anmut to value data. We translate the intangible idea of data into an asset that businesses can better manage, earning higher returns on their data investments and ultimately driving more change. We democratise the value of data, for all those businesses that aren’t Amazon, Alphabet, Apple, Netflix or Microsoft.

Data valuation is a new and challenging field, and we’re at the forefront. Our approach isn’t limited to shareholder value. We also take a broader, more considered view, applying strategic thinking, data science and machine learning to understand the role data plays in the value an organisation creates for its wider stakeholders.

We are building an exceptional team to deliver a suite of innovative software products to support our mission and our clients. As data is intangible... developing products that help bring to life its value and importance in a visually interactive way is an exciting opportunity we need your help with. If you want to be part of a creative and growing business, tackling a complex challenge that matters, read on.

Role

We are looking for a UX designer to join our small, high-energy product team. You will be critical to defining the user experience of our new products by:
• Taking the lead on the UX development aspect of our new products. We have lots of ambitious and exciting ideas and this is an opportunity to really own the UX design aspect of something completely new.
• Gathering requirements from a range of different stakeholders and translating them into user journeys, storyboards and initial design ideas.
• Designing the appropriate flow and layout of solutions which optimise the experience for the user.
• Building visually appealing wireframes and prototypes to bring complex ideas around understanding data to life.
• Think critically about design from the user’s perspective, to design and iterate the most elegant solution possible and help identify likely user issues early.
• Gathering feedback on designs from a wider range of stakeholders
• Working alongside our developers to help convert final designs into software.
• What we look for
• Ability to translate complex customer requirements into user journeys, wireframes and prototypes to demonstrate best practice user experience.
• A strong visual design aesthetic including high quality UI, along with a keen eye for detail.
• Experience in prototyping including proficiency in industry standard design software (e.g. Adobe XD, Sketch, InVision, Figma etc).
• Ability to draw out critical requirements, and identify and predict potential design problems early.
• Strong communication skills and ability to interact clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across the wider business.
• A commitment to the highest quality standards, with designs being clear enough for easy hand off to developers.
• A willingness to seek out feedback and constructive criticism on work produced.
• A pragmatic and flexible attitude – recognition that lack of clarity can be inherent in designing something so new, as well as consideration for technical constraints placed on designs.
• A creative and innovative mind that is not afraid to offer different ideas that are ‘outside the box’
• A real passion to create something that is completely new.

Additional desirable experience
• A degree (preferably in a discipline relevant to Art, Design or Usability), professional certification to a similar level or related work experience
• Experience working within Agile / Sprint based environments
• Experience in designing products from initial design through to hand-off to the development team for build.
• Experience in delivering designs which reflect complex user requirements and deliver measurable business benefits.
• Experience in working in a related field to data management or experience of data management tools e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Collibra
• Knowledge or experience of the technology behind web development e.g. CSS, HTML, JavaScript.

We are looking to shape this role based on finding the right person with a passion to grow with us as a company, and therefore the exact role requirements are flexible based on your previous level of experience. If you do not exactly meet our requirements but feel that you would be a good fit for the role, please apply anyway! Every application is reviewed by our team and we're always looking to evolve our understanding of what a great candidate looks like.

Benefits
• Salary: £TBC based on experience, plus annual bonus. Bi-annual salary reviews.
• Opportunity for equity with career development.
• 25 days annual leave.
• Monthly development reviews.
• Training and development budget for professional development.
• Social events.
• Cycle and run friendly central London office.
• Remote working friendly.
• We are able to offer visa sponsorship (SOC 2137)

Applying

To apply use this link:https://anmut.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=30

On passing initial screening the process is as follows:
• 30 minute phone screening with a member of our Product team

Half day assessment day covering:
• Candidate introductions and fit interview
• Portfolio review
• Whiteboarding design exercise
• CEO interview

Anmut focuses on Big Data, Consulting, Big Data Analytics, Data, and Management Consulting. Their company has offices in London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

Y-combinator backed and recently voted ‘Fintech Start up of the Year 2022’ at Fintech Awards London, Verto helps businesses in emerging markets reach the world by making cross-border payments easy.

We enable businesses to accept payments and send payouts globally in one single platform. Each year we process billions of dollars of payments and provide companies with solutions which help them to save money, automate processes and grow. We have worked with thousands of businesses globally since our launch in 2018 and have high growth aspirations for the future. By 2028 it’s forecasted payments revenue from emerging markets will exceed that of mature markets by $400bn, join Verto to make us the number one B2B payment provider in this space.

The role

As a Web Designer at Verto you’ll report directly to our VP of Growth but also work collaboratively with the product, marketing and content team to iterate the product and make the brand consistent across channels. We’re about... to embark on an overhaul of our marketing website and we’re looking for an ambitious and experienced web designer to lead the change.

Success in this role requires outside-the-box thinkers, we believe that the best designs are made with bold yet thoughtful decisions. With a keen eye for detail and a customer driven approach, you will be focused on producing seamless friction free journeys that drive impactful customer experience and commercial results. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a fast paced environment, can take ownership of design deliverables, confidently bringing their ideas to the table while having a seat at it too.

What you’ll be doing

Leading the redesign of our marketing website from initial research and mapping end-to-end journeys all the way through to final designs and dev implementation, all while keeping our customer experience at the forefront.

Leading the creation and maintenance of a reusable component library as part of our emerging design system to create a cohesive customer experience and improve efficiency.

Presenting design concepts and negotiating with stakeholders to arrive at a design that supports both the business and a strong user experience.

Working with our other designers to develop brand guidelines and assets that support our creative vision and ensure design consistency

Working collaboratively to deliver the best possible experiences for our users, taking into account commercial goals and realities, and technical constraints.

Working to strict deadlines with a proactive approach. Schedule management is key for this role to ensure projects are delivered on time to the specified requirements.

Keeping up to date on current trends, competitors, and the overall market to ensure that Verto is an industry leader.

Requirements

3+ years of experience in a web designer role, preferably within a B2B, Fintech or SaaS environment

Good knowledge of Figma, Sketch, XD, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, or any other tool is also welcomed as long as you can transition to Figma.

Fluent knowledge of user centred design methodologies and approaches

More than just a keen eye for visual design and great taste: you design with purpose and with user experience in mind.

You speak the language of designers, developers, stakeholders, and most importantly - users

Basic awareness of web development principles and coding languages (HTML, CSS, REACT and Javascript)

A passion for learning, the world of design is constantly evolving, and we want our Designers to match this. You’ll bring a proactive approach to problem solving, always striving to improve.

Ownership and growth mentality with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively, with excellent communication and influencing skills

A strong design portfolio. We’d love to see your portfolio as part of your application.

What We Offer

• 31 days holiday each year (Including Bank Holidays)

• 5% Employer contribution towards Pension

• Hybrid working policy

• Regular company social events

• Perkbox Subscription and private health and dental for employees and their family

VertoFX focuses on Payments, Online Marketplaces, Fin Tech, and Digital Currency. Their company has offices in San Francisco, London, and Lagos. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees. To date, VertoFX has raised $12.1M of funding; their latest round was closed on September 2021.

title: UX Designer
description:
Oxford Nanopore Technologies is headquartered at the Oxford Science Park outside Oxford, UK, with satellite offices and commercial presence in many global locations across the US, APAC and Europe.

Oxford Nanopore employs from multiple subject areas including nanopore science, molecular biology and applications, informatics, engineering, electronics, manufacturing and commercialisation. The management team, led by CEO Dr Gordon Sanghera, has a track record of delivering disruptive technologies to the market.

Oxford Nanopore's sequencing platform is the only technology that offers real-time analysis (for rapid insights), in fully scalable formats from pocket to population scale, that can analyse native DNA or RNA and sequence any length of fragment to achieve short to ultra-long read lengths.

Our goal is to enable the analysis of any living thing, by anyone, anywhere. We offer real-time nanopore-based DNA/RNA sequencing technology: accessible, easy to use and fully scalable for any... requirement.

We are looking for a talented and curious individual to join our growing UX Team.

The Details The successful candidate will be part of a growing team responsible for designing and building MinKNOW - our software for running our suite of genetic sequencing devices.

We're looking for a mid-level designer who can contribute to all parts of the design process from user research to visual and interaction design. You don't need to have a background in science, but do need a curious attitude, with a willingness to ask questions.

You'll work closely with product managers and software developers, to identify user needs and translate those into intuitive workflows and interfaces in our software.

Responsibilities: - Collaborate with the Product Management, Development and UX Design teams to define and clarify user requirements and use cases. - Create, iterate on, and deliver UX design concepts, prototypes, as well as UI specifications and assets for use in all stages of the product development process. - Work within, and contribute to the Oxford Nanopore Design System.

What we're looking for You'll to be educated to degree level or equivalent in a relevant subject (UX Design, Human-computer interaction, Human Factors Engineering). You'll have 3-5 years experience in UX design at a software company, ideally including the use of a Design system. Familiarity designing for expert or data intensive software tools is a bonus.

The ideal candidate will: - Have a good understanding of software development lifecycles. - Be experienced in the use of design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Marvel etc. - Good understanding of visual design fundamentals - Have excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with a variety of teams and users, both internal and external. - A curious attitude with a willingness to learn. - An interest in designing for complex scientific products - Possess accurate attention to the small details.

As well as a competitive salary, company benefits also include pension, private healthcare and share options! Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
We’re hiring a Senior UX Designer, tasked to make Sweep an outstanding experience for our users, and a real driver of change for our planet.

Ideally you’re based in London, but if we fall in love with you, Europe and beyond might work just fine as well.

Sweep builds software that lets businesses take control of their climate journey - from managing and reducing emissions, to championing cutting edge climate projects.

I’m intrigued. What would I be doing?

You will have a key role in developing the Sweep user experience. Together with the team, you will turn complex sustainability standards, data sets and interactions into interfaces that are easy to understand and a joy to navigate.

This will require you to develop a deep understanding of corporate sustainability practices and combine research, design thinking and user testing to create smart interactions.

You will be seeing projects through from start to finish, working in close collaboration with our product, engineering and... carbon staff.

This position will allow you to shape our design approach from the ground up, planting the seeds for many good things to come.

Nice. Can you be a bit more specific please?

In your day to day, you will...

1. Design software for a better future 🎨
• Help steer our product design from crucial big architectural strokes down to the smallest interaction that makes all the difference.
• Kick off the design process through exploration, ideation and user validation.
• Design interaction models, wireframes and prototypes that focus on ease of use and optimise how customers interact with our software.
• Present design solutions, defend design decisions and incorporate feedback into the design cycle.

2. Build the Sweep design system ⚙️
• Ensure a consistent brand and UI experience across the whole customer journey.
• Maintain a unified, scalable and progressive design system through libraries and documentation.
• Make sure that we build accessibility into our product right from the start.

3. Establish our user research practice 🔬
• Organise and host design critiques and user research labs.
• Gather and document insights that will influence our UX, feature development and roadmaps.
• Help establish best practices for user research at Sweep.

4. Be an advocate for good design 🎙
• Actively develop a positive, productive and passionate design culture within Sweep.
• Represent our mission externally, through active exchange with the design industry, to help build Sweep’s network and thought leadership credentials.

That sounds just right for me. What do I need to bring?

Good you asked. This is who we’re looking for:

Qualifications 🏆
• You bring a minimum of 5 years of experience in software product design
• Experience in software-as-a-service environments, ideally in the B2B space
• Proven expertise turning complex business problems into simple and engaging products
• Strong command of interaction design, visual design and information architecture
• Experience working closely with multi-disciplinary teams
• Adept at communicating and prototyping interactions rapidly at all levels of resolution
• A deep knowledge of modern web UI patterns

Qualities 🧠
• You’re an empathetic team player that is great at building lasting relationships
• A strategic thinker, who sees both the big picture and the smaller underlying mechanics
• An expert English language communicator that has a knack for breaking down complex topics both verbally and written. Also, French is an added bonus
• A hands-on problem solver, self-motivated with a glass half-full attitude
• An entrepreneurial mind, ready to launch and fail and iterate
• Attuned to remote collaboration, using digital tools and meticulously documenting work
• A desire and ambition to grow, mentor and support other designers on the team

Ok, sounds fun. What’s in it for me?

You will be joining an exciting young business that has the humble ambition to change the world. With a proven track record in starting companies, we’re planning to hit the ground running and have an impact fast. Joining this journey right at the beginning allows you to really help shape our path.

You will join a dynamic (mostly remote) team of engineers, business minds, creatives and carbon experts spread across France and the UK. We’re a fun bunch of people that want to work hard, and enjoy ourselves while doing so. And we believe in creating a calm environment, that knows that life is not just work, and we’ll be doing better work because of that.

We’re big believers in creating successful businesses that are good for everyone, including society and the planet. That’s why we have a BCorp Startup status.

We think this might be the ride of our lives. And maybe yours, too.

To apply, please submit both a CV and a portfolio. Make sure to showcase your design process, UX flows, interaction patterns and visual design skills. Please also provide details of your role on the projects.

Sweep focuses on SaaS, Clean Technology, and Marketplaces. Their company has offices in London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.
